title: Moderna, Coinbase, Occidental, Royal Caribbean: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Vaccine makers were extending gains; Travel stocks were clawing back some of last week's losses
text:
* New Covid restrictions are rattling the travel industry again, although airlines said the busy Thanksgiving weekend generally went smoothly. Southwest Airlines rose 2.4% premarket, Delta Air Lines gained 3.6% and American Airlines climbed 2.8%.

* Cruise lines were also recovering from some of their big declines last week, with Carnival up 5.2% premarket and Royal Caribbean up 5.6%.

* Crude prices were also clawing back some of last week's drop, and energy producers were climbing. Occidental Petroleum gained 4.3%, Devon Energy rose 3.2% and Diamondback Energy rose 3.3%. Oil-services company Halliburton was up 3.4%.

* Zoom Video Communications got a boost last week as investors considered the prospect of an extended period of remote work. That trade was partially reversing early Monday, with the stock down 2.4%.

* Bitcoin was also on the rise, up 2% from its price on Sunday to $57,379.75. Coinbase shares gained 2.3%, and bitcoin miners Marathon Digital and Hut 8 Mining gained 5.4% and 4.4% respectively.

* Merck and Ridgeback Biotherapeutics on Friday said a final analysis of their experimental Covid-19 pill found the drug less effective than an early look, prompting U.S. health regulators to continue a staff review of the drug's application days before an outside panel meets. Merck shares were down 2.7% premarket.

Chart of the Day

* Private-equity firms have announced a record $944.4 billion worth of buyouts in the U.S. so far this year, more than double the volume of the previous peak in 2007.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com
